info.title: simcore-service-storage
info.description: Service that manages osparc storage backend

schema.title: Response Get File Metadata V0 Locations  Location Id  Files  File Id  Metadata Get

put.description:
creates upload file links:

This function covers v1 and v2 versions of the handler.
Note: calling this entrypoint on an already existing file will overwrite that file. That file will be deleted
before the upload takes place.

v1 rationale:
    - client calls this handler, which returns a single link (either direct S3 or presigned) to the S3 backend
    - client uploads the file
    - storage relies on lazy update to find if the file is finished uploaded (when client calls get_file_meta_data, or if the dsm_cleaner goes over it after the upload time is expired)

v2 rationale:
    - client calls this handler, which returns a FileUploadSchema object containing 1 or more links (either S3/presigned links)
    - client uploads the file (by chunking it if there are more than 1 presigned link)
    - client calls complete_upload handle which will reconstruct the file on S3 backend
    - client waits for completion to finish and then the file is accessible on S3 backend


Use-case v1: query.file_size is not defined, returns a PresignedLink model (backward compatibility)
Use-case v1.1: if query.link_type=presigned or None, returns a presigned link (limited to a single 5GB file)
Use-case v1.2: if query.link_type=s3, returns a s3 direct link (limited to a single 5TB file)

User-case v2: query.is_directory is True (query.file_size is forced to -1), returns an s3 path where to upload all the content of the directory
User-case v2: if query.file_size is defined, returns a FileUploadSchema model, expects client to call "complete_upload" when the file is finished uploading
Use-case v2.1: if query.file_size == 0 and query.link_type=presigned or None, returns a single presigned link inside FileUploadSchema (limited to a single 5Gb file)
Use-case v2.2: if query.file_size > 0 and query.link_type=presigned or None, returns 1 or more presigned links depending on the file size (limited to a single 5TB file)
Use-case v2.3: if query.link_type=s3 and query.file_size>=0, returns a single s3 direct link (limited to a single 5TB file)

schema.title: Response Upload File V0 Locations  Location Id  Files  File Id  Put

post.summary: Get Or Create Temporary S3 Access

services.title: Services
services.description: Other backend services connected from this service

sessions.title: Sessions
sessions.description: Client sessions info. If single session per app, then is denoted as main

diagnostics_url.title: Diagnostics Url
diagnostics_url.description: Link to diagnostics report sub-resource. This MIGHT take some time to compute

current_page.title: Current Page
current_page.description: Cursor to refetch the current page

current_page_backwards.title: Current Page Backwards
current_page_backwards.description: Cursor to refetch the current page starting from the last item

file_uuid.title: File Uuid
file_uuid.description: NOT a unique ID, like (api|uuid)/uuid/file_name or DATCORE folder structure

project_name.title: Project Name
project_name.description: optional project name, used by frontend to display path

node_name.title: Node Name
node_name.description: optional node name, used by frontend to display path

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: THIS IS the unique ID for the file. either (api|project_id)/node_id/file_name.ext for S3 and N:package:UUID for datcore

file_size.title: File Size
file_size.description: File size in bytes (-1 means invalid)

entity_tag.title: Entity Tag
entity_tag.description: Entity tag (or ETag), represents a specific version of the file, None if invalid upload or datcore

is_soft_link.title: Is Soft Link
is_soft_link.description: If true, this file is a soft link.i.e. is another entry with the same object_name

is_directory.title: Is Directory
is_directory.description: if True this is a directory

sha256_checksum.title: Sha256 Checksum
sha256_checksum.description: SHA256 message digest of the file content. Main purpose: cheap lookup.

path.title: Path
path.description: the path to the current path

display_path.title: Display Path
display_path.description: the path to display with UUID replaced (URL Encoded by parts as names may contain '/')

file_meta_data.description: if filled, this is the file meta data of the s3 object

S3_ENDPOINT.title: S3 Endpoint
S3_ENDPOINT.description: do not define if using standard AWS
